title: Swashed slab or soft serif type
content:
Any suggestions for faces that could be cut and swashed, or include a subset of swashes - in the vain of cooper, belizio, fortune, volta, etc.

the general feel is small grocery store - organic - hometown and warm

also - anyone know the face used to set “Cheers” for the bar/ TV show

thx !

 [‹ (x) 50s retro script - Magneto {Dav}](http://web.archive.org/web/20071023163418/http:/typophile.com/node/18177 "Go to previous forum topic") [Russian and Chinese type ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071023163418/http:/typophile.com/node/17914 "Go to next forum topic")
author: versa

comments.content:
[Sauna](http://web.archive.org/web/20071023163418/http:/www.underware.nl/site2/index.php3?id1=sauna&id2=blackitalicswash) is probably up your alley.

What do you mean by “cut”?

Here is a good thread on type for organic foods: [http://www.typophile.com/node/17373](http://web.archive.org/web/20071023163418/http:/www.typophile.com/node/17373 "http://www.typophile.com/node/17373")

yeah,sorry for my explanation - i just meant something that might be a nice base, and could be cut up from there a bit, to add custom swashing, etc. if need be ...

thx

I dunno...do you have any examples of typefaces that COULDN’T be swashed, if one were to use a little imagination (an ability which, I am told on good authority, I sadly lack)? Your follow-up isn’t a whole lot more helpful that your original question...

thx

Let me see if a comparison would help clear up my poor explanation ...

underware’s “bello” - it’s well suited for this i think, but i was trying to discover some comparable type

i also was interested in finding out what “cheers” ( for the TV show ) was set in - i believe i’ve seen it at fontshop ? but cannot remember the name

[This](http://web.archive.org/web/20071023163418/http:/www.antoniogenna.net/doppiaggio/telefilm/cheers.jpg) is certainly hand drawn, but [Candice](http://web.archive.org/web/20071023163418/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontdetail&displayfontid=EF.101005.0.0&attributes.sampleSize=60&sampleText=Cheers&sampleSize=95) is similar.

definately handdrawn, but i found what i thought it had been based on -

[http://www.myfonts.com/search?search%5Btext%5D=cabaret](http://web.archive.org/web/20071023163418/http:/www.myfonts.com/search?search%5Btext%5D=cabaret "http://www.myfonts.com/search?search%5Btext%5D=cabaret")

still looking for some suggestions for the other

much appreciated ...

If you are indeed goin’ for the smooth, warm, soft, slightly handmade look, you may like the lovely ’ [Los Feliz](http://web.archive.org/web/20071023163418/http:/www.emigre.com/EF.php?fid=102)’, by Christian Schwartz, or the brandnew ’ [Manifest Destiny](http://web.archive.org/web/20071023163418/http:/www.t26.com/fonts/display.php?f_id=857)’, by Jack Usine.

Dav
